pull.title: test: [refactor] Use g_rand_ctx directly
pull.body:
This is mostly a style-cleanup for the tests' random generation:

1) `g_insecure_rand_ctx` in the tests is problematic, because the name is a leftover when the generator was indeed insecure. However, now the generator is *deterministic*, because the seed is either passed in or printed (c.f. RANDOM_CTX_SEED). Stating that deterministic randomness is insecure in the tests seems redundant at best. Fix it by just using `g_rand_ctx` for the name.


2) The global random context has many one-line aliases, such as `InsecureRand32`. This is problematic, because the same line of code may use the context directly and through a wrapper at the same time. For example in net_tests (see below). This inconsistency is harmless, but confusing. Fix it by just removing the one-line aliases.

```
src/test/net_tests.cpp:        auto msg_data_1 = g_insecure_rand_ctx.randbytes<uint8_t>(InsecureRandRange(100000));
````

The first two points are handled in a scripted-diff, which is the largest chunk of this pull request.


3) The wrapper for randmoney has the same problem that the same unit test uses the context directly and through a wrapper at the same time. Also, it has a single type of Rng hardcoded. Fix it by accepting any type.


4) Also, add a commit to verify `RANDOM_CTX_SEED` (this is the only non-refactoring change).

parent 9774a958b501a6d439a734e18b29e04f59f973f6
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722588855 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722589819 +0200

scripted-diff: [test] Use g_rand_ctx directly

-BEGIN VERIFY SCRIPT-

 ren() { sed -i "s:\<$1\>:$2:g" $( git grep -l "$1" ./src ) ; }

 ren g_insecure_rand_ctx_temp_path g_rand_ctx_temp_path
 ren g_insecure_rand_ctx           g_rand_ctx
 ren InsecureRand32                g_rand_ctx.rand32
 ren InsecureRand256               g_rand_ctx.rand256
 ren InsecureRandBits              g_rand_ctx.randbits
 ren InsecureRandRange             g_rand_ctx.randrange
 ren InsecureRandBool              g_rand_ctx.randbool

 # Delete unused aliases
 sed -i '30,54d' ./src/test/util/random.h

-END VERIFY SCRIPT-

tree e16bd8e629f2fd2c2338c6a66ca463dfb16d0738
parent fa59dd5d141ed8a3d37e74a6de024eb6f1aa1893
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722590694 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722590790 +0200

test: refactor: Make unsigned promotion explicit

Integer promotion will already turn the `signed` into `unsigned` in
those lines. However, make the `unsigned` explicit so that the code is
clearer and a compiler warning is avoided:

| test/validation_block_tests.cpp: warning: comparison of integers of different signs: 'int' and 'const unsigned int' [-Wsign-compare]
|   136 |     bool gen_invalid = g_rand_ctx.randrange(100) < invalid_rate;
|       |                        ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ^ ~~~~~~~~~~~~
|   137 |     bool gen_fork = g_rand_ctx.randrange(100) < branch_rate;
|       |                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ^ ~~~~~~~~~~~
| 2 warnings generated.

tree 6f11466c932c69311e1a0a7b5c7be733330ac170
parent fabaabac8e8be49b3fd436b224e97e457e90497b
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722591249 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722591025 +0200

test: refactor: Accept any RandomNumberGenerator in RandMoney

Accepting any Rng in RandMoney makes tests more flexible to use a
different Rng. Also, passing in the Rng clarifies the call sites, so
that they all use g_rand_ctx explicitly and consistently.

verification.payload:
tree 0f99f333e1ab8c70a6f0aa04631f9a733cb79b27
parent fa6685e7348903c5bcd318c8acbf85ddf7ab07c5
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722592449 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1722592589 +0200

test: Only accept a fully valid RANDOM_CTX_SEED

This rejects if the seed is corrupt, truncated, too-long, or otherwise
contains non-hex.

For example, "RANDOM_CTX_SEED=z".

Can be tested with:

$ RANDOM_CTX_SEED=z ./src/test/test_bitcoin --log_level=all --run_test=timeoffsets_tests/timeoffsets_warning -- -printtoconsole=1 | grep RANDOM_CTX_SEED
test/util/random.cpp:29 operator(): Assertion `uint256::FromHex(num)' failed.

comments.body: Just for my own understanding, the advantage here is now that any rng in a test can be used when calling RandMoney? Before it was limited in some way?

Correct, this is one of two reasons. Generally, I try to put the motivation and explanation of the changes in the commit body. I presume you are referring to fa6685e7348903c5bcd318c8acbf85ddf7ab07c5, which lists both reasons for the change?
Ah got it, makes sense. I need to check the individual commits. Thanks.
